summary: The Help Independent Tracks Succeed Act (HITS Act) amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow an election to expense certain qualified sound recording costs, similar to existing provisions for film and theatrical productions.  It defines "qualified sound recording production" and sets a dollar limitation of $150,000 for the aggregate cost eligible for expensing.  The bill also modifies bonus depreciation rules and makes conforming amendments to the tax code. The amendments apply to productions starting in taxable years ending after the bill's enactment.
